Title: Experts rally private  sector to AfCFTA  implementation
Summary: Economic experts have declared that Nigeria’s economic future depends on how effectively the country can mobilise its private sector to drive production, innovation and trade across the continent .

Title: Bribe-for-Bills: SERAP sues Akpabio, Abbas over failure to probe scandal
Summary: SERAP sues Senate President, Godswill Akpabio, and Speaker of the House of Representatives, Tajudeen Abbas, at the Federal High Court sitting in Abuja .

Title: EU, France invest €10.2m to boost Nigeria’s  pharmaceutical manufacturing
Summary: EU and France commit €10.2 million investment to strengthen Nigeria’s pharmaceutical manufacturing capacity . Officials describe it as a major step towards health sovereignty and industrial transformation .

Title: BAT Nigeria leads energy transition, pushes for private sector-led climate action
Summary: BAT Nigeria has reaffirmed its commitment to advancing the country's sustainability agenda . It emphasised the critical role of the private sector in driving climate action and economic resilience across the continent . BAT Nigeria leads energy transition, pushes for private sector-led climate action .

Title: Structural engineers lament unethical practices in project execution
Summary: Structural engineers under the aegis of the Nigerian Institution of Structural Engineers (NIStructE) warn that such trends threaten safety and professionalism in the nation's construction sector .

Title: Student loan scheme records over one million applications  —  NELFUND
Summary: NELFUND attributed the success of the initiative to President Tinubu’s Renewed Hope agenda, which prioritises inclusive access to education . The student loan scheme records over one million applications .

Title: Afreximbank, Ogun partner on fabric processing zone financing
Summary: African Export and Import Bank (Afreximbank) is set to partner with the Ogun State government to drive fabric processing finance . New President of Afreximank, George Elombi, vowed his tenure will bring an end to raw commodities or mineral exports .

Title: Anambra election: Police step up surveillance with helicopters, drones
Summary: The Police Headquarters, Abuja has deployed its tactical teams with helicopters and drones . The Police Public Relations Officer in the state, SP Tochukwu Ikenga, disclosed this in a statement on Sunday in Awka .

Title: NELFUND records 1 million student loan applications, disburses N116bn
Summary: The Nigerian Education Loan Fund, NELFUND, has recorded a major breakthrough . Over one million applications had been received on its students loan portal since its official launch on May 24, 2024 .

Title: MAN foresees improved manufacturing output in 2026
Summary: Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN) Projects 3.1% real growth, 10.2% contribution to real GDP in 2026 . MAN’s Director of Managing Director of Nigeria's Manufacturers, Yinka Kolawole, said the sector will improve in the coming year .

Title: Kano approves ₦8.2bn for education, water, energy projects
Summary: The Kano State Executive Council has approved more than ₦8.2 billion for a series of projects targeted at revitalising education, strengthening water supply, and enhancing energy efficiency . The approvals were announced in separate statements issued on Sunday by the governor’s spokesperson, Sanusi Bature .

Title: Fans lament poor security, chaos at Davido’s Enugu concert
Summary: Davido's '5ive Tour' in Nigeria drew widespread criticism on Saturday, November 1 . Attendees described scenes of overcrowding, harassment, weak crowd control, and security lapses . Davido arrived at 3 a.m. to perform at Michael Okpara Square in Enugu, Enugu .

Title: Tanzania president claims 98% victory amid protests, internet blackout
Summary: State television said the public would not attend the inauguration, which would be held in the capital, Dodoma, rather than a stadium as usual . The electoral commission says Hassan won 98 per cent of the vote . The main opposition party, Chadema, has rejected the results and called for fresh elections . A total internet blackout has been in

Title: Mr President, don’t punish Nigerians again with 15% fuel import tariff
Summary: Nigerians have endured subsidy removal, foreign exchange shocks, inflation that eats wages before payday . They did so because you asked for time — time to rebuild, to reform, to restore . Now, after this difficult year of sacrifice, the government has confirmed it will introduce a 15 per cent import duty on petrol and diesel .

Title: Trump’s military intervention threat illegal — SANs
Summary: Senior Advocates of Nigeria have faulted the threat by U.S. President, Donald Trump, to deploy American troops to Nigeria over alleged killings of Christians . They say such a move would amount to an invasion and a violation of Nigeria’s sovereignty under international law . Trump designated Nigeria a “Country of Particular Concern�
